hypothesis_content.title: Liquidity-Driven Volatility Compression Breakout
hypothesis_content.statement: Current low volatility regime (BTC 10-day realized vol < 40%) will compress further for 2-5 days post-Fed news, then experience a directional breakout >5% within 48 hours of compression ending.
hypothesis_content.rationale: Liquidity shifts often manifest first as volatility compression (indecision) then explosive moves as new information gets priced. Fed policy changes represent macro information that eventually forces directional resolution.
entry_conditions: BTC 10-day realized volatility < 40% and declining for 3 days
Bollinger Band (20,2) width on 4H chart < 0.8x its 20-day average
Breakout trigger: 4H candle closes >2% above/below 20-period EMA with 1.5x average volume

exit_conditions.take_profit: 7% move in breakout direction OR volatility expands to >60% (10-day RV)
exit_conditions.stop_loss: Breakout fails: price returns to within 0.5% of pre-breakout level
exit_conditions.time_exit: 5 days after breakout if neither TP nor SL hit

hypothesis_content.falsification_criteria: Volatility remains compressed (<45%) for >7 days without directional breakout, or breakout occurs but immediately reverses (fakeout).
